evidence.text: Modified on 5/22/2017 Docket entries 61-1 through 61-11 are STRICKEN from the RECORD Pursuant to Order 72 Entered May 22, 2017.

ORDER GRANTING leave to the plaintiffs to amend or clarify, within 21 days, any fact, claim, party or theory in their complaint. The substantive provisions of the pretrial orders (documents 11 and 19) are REINSTATED. The parties are ORDERED to meet and confer within 30 days of this Order to establish a trial date from which to calculate the deadlines in the pretrial order. The parties may recommence discovery after the filing of the amended complaint. Signed by Senior Judge Norman K. Moon on 6/22/18.
Oral ORDER granting 101 MOTION for Alyssa M. Pazandak to Appear Pro Hac Vice. Entered by Magistrate Judge Joel C. Hoppe on 11/9/18.
Oral ORDER granting 119 MOTION for Neil K. Gilman to Appear Pro Hac Vice in this case. Entered by Magistrate Judge Joel C. Hoppe on 11/27/18.
MOTION for Laura A. Lange to Appear Pro Hac Vice. Entered by Magistrate Judge Joel C. Hoppe on 3/11/2019.
VACATED ON 8/29/2023 - ORDER denying 234 Motion for Attorney Fees; adopting 243 Report and Recommendations; overruling
